title: Israel Strikes Gaza and Temporarily Halts Aid, Saying Hamas Broke Truce
summary: Israel launched a wave of attacks on Gaza after accusing Palestinian militants of attacking its forces across cease-fire lines. Both sides say they are still committed to the truce.

title: Far From Gaza, a Palestinian Enclave Thrives, Even as War Feels Near
summary: Fifteen miles west of Manhattan, in Paterson, N.J., a community is directly, and often painfully, connected to a conflict half a world away.

title: Where Does the Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Stand?
summary: Unresolved issues and flare-ups of violence threaten to destabilize the fragile agreement.

title: Colombia’s Leader Accuses U.S. of Murder, Prompting Trump to Halt Aid
summary: President Gustavo Petro said a U.S. strike in the Caribbean had killed a fisherman. President Trump said he would cut aid and impose new tariffs on Colombian imports.

title: Shell Detonated Over Interstate 5 During Marines Event, California Officials Say
summary: The mishap, during an anniversary celebration for the Marine Corps attended by the vice president and defense secretary, underscores safety concerns that Gov. Gavin Newsom voiced before Saturday’s event at Camp Pendleton.

title: U.S. Kills 3 on Boat Suspected of Smuggling Drugs for Colombian Rebels
summary: It was the seventh known strike in President Trump’s military campaign of attacking, rather than arresting, those suspected of running drugs in the Caribbean.

title: Louvre Robbers Take ‘Priceless’ French Jewels
summary: The robbers employed a portable electric ladder to break into a second-floor wing of the Paris museum that holds the French crown jewels.

title: Louvre Robbery: What Was Stolen
summary: The stolen items include glittering royal tiaras, necklaces and earrings.

title: Santos Thanks Trump During TV Appearances After His Release From Prison
summary: Mr. Santos, the disgraced congressman from Long Island, lashed out at the warden of the prison where he had been held and suggested he was now free to get Botox.

title: It’s 2025, and Democrats Are Still Running Against Trump
summary: In New Jersey, Virginia and beyond, voters have been inundated with ads linking Republican candidates to the president. Some Democratic strategists see a missed opportunity to forge a more positive message.

title: Mamdani and Cuomo Make Their Cases in Last Weekend Before Early Voting
summary: As the New York City mayoral campaign enters its final weeks, the candidates appeared at a forum at Queens College and at a soccer tournament in Coney Island.

title: The Democratic Mayor Who Thinks Cities Are Handling Trump Wrong
summary: Mayor John Whitmire of Houston believes the best way to govern a diverse, immigrant-heavy city in the current political climate is by keeping your head down and your ambitions modest.

title: A Tower on Billionaires’ Row Is Full of Cracks. Who’s to Blame?
summary: A superstar team of architects and developers insisted on an all-white concrete facade. It could explain some of the building’s problems.

title: An ICE Raid at a Building in Chicago Swept Up Dozens of U.S. Citizens
summary: An immigration raid on an apartment building in Chicago followed years of problems with crime, and neglect by landlords. It swept up dozens of U.S. citizens who were detained in the middle of the night.

title: What Powers Does the Border Patrol Have Across the Country?
summary: The Trump administration is increasingly relying on the agency for immigration enforcement within the U.S.

title: The Tech Right Gets Its Own Phyllis Schlafly
summary: Katherine Boyle, an influential venture capitalist who is a friend of the vice president, thinks the country’s path forward involves cultural conservatism and more weapons production.

title: An Ode to October Baseball
summary: With the World Series just days away, we look at the beauty of baseball — even if one team looks unbeatable.

title: For Alaskan Evacuees, Home Is Gone, With No Return in Sight
summary: Their communities devastated from last weekend’s storm, many are in shelters in Anchorage and facing life in a completely different world.

title: Peanut Allergies Have Plummeted in Children, Study Shows
summary: Doctors have long recommended that infants avoid peanuts. But in 2017, experts officially reversed that guidance, and food allergies decreased sharply.

title: Sanae Takaichi Is Set to Be Japan’s First Female Prime Minister. But Will She Advance Women’s Rights?
summary: Sanae Takaichi is poised to break Japan’s political glass ceiling. But some worry she will maintain policies that have held women back.

title: How Wendell Pierce Spends His Day Exploring New York City
summary: Mr. Pierce, the popular actor from shows like “The Wire,” said time is precious. He spends his shopping in Harlem, walking through Central Park and staying up all night listening to jazz.

title: Trump Is Dragging Us Down to His Level
summary: The Young Republicans’ Telegram chat was revealing in so many ways.

title: The HBO Miniseries ‘Task’ Gets Rural America Right
summary: Since the first election of President Trump, Hollywood has fretted about portraying rural and red state Americans. Some new TV series show how to get it right.

title: Emirates Cargo Plane Slides Off Hong Kong Runway, Killing 2 Ground Crew
summary: The plane, arriving from Dubai, skidded off the runway after landing and fell into the sea, Hong Kong officials said.

title: China’s Economy Held Steady in the Third Quarter, but Consumers Were More Cautious
summary: A further increase in China’s trade surplus failed to fully offset the effects of a worsening housing market, which has left consumers wary.

title: Sam Rivers, Bassist for Limp Bizkit, Dies at 48
summary: As a founding member of the band, he helped it achieve mainstream success.
